citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There was no updated copy of the written program of veterinary care available during the inspection. While the facility
does have an attending veterinarian, there was no documentation of the attending veterinarian information or the details
of all animal species veterinary care protocols at the facility.
The lack of a written program of veterinary care could cause a lapse in timely preventative treatments or unapproved
process/products used for health care approved by the attending veterinarian.
Each dealer and exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time
attending veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary
care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the dealer or exhibitor.
To be corrected by: March 15, 2025

The inventory of the facility is behind six months in the updating of regulated animals that are at the facility, including
those that were born/died and sold. While the inventory from May 2024 is available and some births and deaths are
written down, and multiple receipts of some sales or purchases are available, several of these records are left incomplete
and not up to date since May 2024.
The lack of an up to date inventory, births and deaths, and sales records can prevent the accuracy for proper
management and traceability of the regulated animals.
Each dealer, other than operators of auction sales and brokers to whom animals are consigned, and each exhibitor shall
make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information concerning each
dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her
control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall
include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control.
To be corrected by: March 30, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
There was no updated copy of the written program of veterinary care available during the inspection. While the facility 
does have an attending veterinarian, there was no documentation of the attending veterinarian information or the details 
of all animal species veterinary care protocols at the facility. 
 
The lack of a written program of veterinary care could cause a lapse in timely preventative treatments or unapproved 
process/products used for health care approved by the attending veterinarian. 
 
Each dealer and exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time 
attending veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary 
care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the dealer or exhibitor. 
 
To be corrected by: March 15, 2025 
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The inventory of the facility is behind six months in the updating of regulated animals that are at the facility, including 
those that were born/died and sold. While the inventory from May 2024 is available and some births and deaths are 
written down, and multiple receipts of some sales or purchases are available, several of these records are left incomplete 
and not up to date since May 2024. 
 
The lack of an up to date inventory, births and deaths, and sales records can prevent the accuracy for proper 
management and traceability of the regulated animals. 
 
Each dealer, other than operators of auction sales and brokers to whom animals are consigned, and each exhibitor shall 
make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information concerning each 
dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her 
control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall 
include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control.

To be corrected by: March 30, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
